info.title: PDF Services API
info.description:
• Learn more about using Adobe PDF Services API.
  • Invoking PDF Services API requires an Adobe-provided credential, learn more about authentication.
  • Downloadable SDKs
  • Click here to download sample Postman collection
  • Click here to download sample Postman collection with External Storage
  • Click here to know more about multi-region support for PDF Services API
  • Support Forum
  • First released on 26th September, 2022
  • To use your custom external storage, click here.

tags.name: Generate Token
tags.description: Creates an access token using client id and client secret. Click here to refer underlying IMS authentication APIs.

tags.name: Assets
tags.description:
Upload and download assets to Adobe internal storage.
Uploading and downloading of assets is not required when using a custom external storage solution with signed URLs.
Note: Assets uploaded to Adobe internal storage are transiently stored for 24 hours.

tags.name: Create PDF
tags.description: Create PDF document from Microsoft Office documents (Word, Excel and PowerPoint) and Image file formats.

tags.name: Export PDF
tags.description: Convert a PDF File to a non-PDF File

tags.name: PDF To Images
tags.description: Convert a PDF File to image files

tags.name: Extract PDF
tags.description: Extract content from PDF documents and output it in a structured JSON format, along with tables and figures

tags.name: Html to PDF
tags.description: Convert HTML Resources to a PDF File

tags.name: Combine PDF
tags.description: Combine multiple PDF Files into a single PDF File

tags.name: Compress PDF
tags.description: Compress a PDF File

tags.name: Linearize PDF
tags.description: Convert a PDF File to a Linearized or Web Optimized PDF File

tags.name: OCR
tags.description: Perform OCR on a PDF File

tags.name: Page Manipulation
tags.description: Rotate and delete pages of a PDF File

tags.name: PDF Properties
tags.description: Extract basic information about a PDF document.

tags.name: Protect PDF
tags.description: Add encryption and/or restrict permissions on a PDF File

tags.name: Remove Protection
tags.description: Remove password protection from a PDF File

tags.name: Split PDF
tags.description: Split a PDF File into multiple PDF Files

tags.name: Document Generation
tags.description: Merge Word based templates with input JSON data to create Word and PDF documents

tags.name: PDF Electronic Seal
tags.description: Create electronic seal on PDF documents like invoices, agreements etc using the digital certificate issued to the user by Trust Service Provider.

tags.name: PDF Accessibility Auto-Tag
tags.description: Operation to create the tagged pdf and excel report for accessibility auto-tag use case.

tags.name: PDF Accessibility Checker
tags.description: Accessibility Checker API will check PDF files to see if they meet the machine-verifiable requirements of PDF/UA and WCAG 2.0.

tags.name: PDF Watermark
tags.description: PDF Watermark API will add a watermark in PDF document.

tags.name: Export PDF Form Data
tags.description: The Export PDF Form Data API will retrieve the data from a PDF form and return it as a JSON file.

tags.name: Import PDF Form Data
tags.description: The Import PDF Form Data API will take the form data provided as a JSON, insert it into the PDF form, and generate the resulting PDF.

post.summary: Get upload pre-signed URI.
post.description:
Get the pre-signed URI to directly upload the content to the adobe's internal cloud provider. Output: Response will have the asset URI of created asset and pre-signed URI for uploading the content.
Note: The pre-signed URI provided for uploading or downloading the content has an expiry of 1 hour.

post.summary: Extract content from PDF documents and output it in a structured JSON format, along with tables and figures
post.description:
Extract PDF Content, Tables content and Tables/Figures renditions from a PDF document. Various available options are: (mutually exclusive)

1. Extract text with structure (headings, paragraphs, lists and footnotes)

2. Extract tables data as CSV or XLSX

3. Extract tables as images.

4. Extract bounding boxes for characters present in text blocks(paragraphs, list, headings)

5. Extract figures or images as PNG

parameters.description: Bearer + Token (Learn more about getting the access token)

post.summary: Convert HTML Resources to a PDF File
post.description: Creates PDFs from static/dynamic HTML or HTML(with inline CSS) or just a URL. It's a common scenario for enterprise to provide end users with a HTML template with form fields. In case of dynamic HTML this API allows you to capture the users unique data entries and then save it as PDF. Collected data is stored in a JSON file, and the source HTML file must include \. You can also provide the URL of the HTML page in inputUrl parameter. However, creating PDF from URL is not supported in External Storage flow.

parameters.description: Bearer + Token (Learn more about getting the access token)

post.summary: Split a PDF File into multiple PDF Files
post.description:
Split a PDF document into multiple smaller documents by simply specifying either the number of files, pages per file, or page ranges. Various available options are: (mutually exclusive)

1. Use the page count to specify the maximum number of pages in each of the output file(s).

2. Creating smaller PDFs with a set number of pages, you can split PDFs into multiple smaller documents by specifying page ranges where each page range corresponds to a single output file.

3. Split PDFs by file count. In this case, the operation creates the specified number of files with each containing an identical number of pages (if possible).

json.description: JavaScript variables to be placed in global scope to reference while rendering the HTML. This mechanism is intended to be used to supply data that might otherwise be retrieved using ajax requests. The actual mechanics of accessing this content varies depending if rendering from a zip file or from a url. When rendering from a zip file, the source collateral must include a script element such as: \<script src='./json.js' type='text/javascript'>\</script> When rendering from a URL, the content of this json object is injected into the browser VM before the page is rendered.

compressionLevel.description:
Specify the level of compression to reduce the file size of the pdf. Supported levels of compression which reduces the file size of pdf:

1. Low : Reduces resolution of the coloured and grayscale images above 250 dpi to 200 dpi. This option uses JP2K high quality compression.

2. Medium : Reduces resolution of the coloured and grayscale images above 200 dpi to 144 dpi. This option uses JP2K medium quality compression.

3. High : Reduces resolution of the coloured and grayscale images above 100 dpi to 72 dpi. This option uses JPEG medium quality compression. Output pdf will not contain hidden layers, document structure, metadata, javascript, user properties and print settings.

ocrType.description:
Specifies OCR Type. 

There are two types which produce a different result:

1. One type ensures that text is searchable and selectable, but modifies the original image during the cleanup process (for example, deskews it) before placing an invisible text layer over it. This type removes unwanted artifacts and may result in a more readable document in some scenarios.

2. The second (EXACT) type, also overlays a searchable text layer over the original image, but in this case, the original image is unchanged. This type produces maximum fidelity to the original image.

passwordProtection.description: Enables the use of passwords to encrypt the input PDF document. At least one of userPassword and ownerPassword must be specified and non-empty. Each password can be up to 128 characters in length.

encryptionAlgorithm.description: Sets the encryption algorithm. For AES-128 encryption, the password supports LATIN-I characters only. For AES-256 encryption, the password supports Unicode character set.

contentToEncrypt.description: Sets the type of content to be encrypted. If ONLY_EMBEDDED_FILES option is set, it will render any provided access permissions as ineffective.

permissions.description: Permissions to allow printing, editing and content copying in the PDF document. By default, none of the specified actions are permitted. PRINT_HIGH_QUALITY permission includes PRINT_LOW_QUALITY permission. EDIT_CONTENT permission includes EDIT_DOCUMENT_ASSEMBLY and EDIT_FILL_AND_SIGN_FORM_FIELDS permissions. Permissions settings will only be used in case the ownerPassword is set.

angle.description: Required for 'rotate' cmd. It specifies the clockwise rotation angle relative to the starting orientation of the page. e.g. if a page is already rotated 90 degrees (landscape), specifying a rotation of 90 degrees will rotate it a further 90 degrees. The valid rotation angles are: 90, 180, 270.

userPassword.description: Password used to control opening of an encrypted PDF document. When this property is included and non-empty, the use of a password (either this one or, if specified, the owner password) is necessary to open/view the document. If this password is empty or omitted the document can be opened automatically by conforming PDF viewers.

ownerPassword.description: Password used to control permissions in a PDF document. Conforming PDF viewers require this password to change the permissions. This password can also be used to open/view the PDF document.

pageRanges.description: Page ranges on the basis of which to split the input PDF file. Each page range corresponds to a single output file having the pages specified in the page range. The page ranges may not overlap.

start.description: Start page of this page range. Page numbers are indexed from 1 to N.

end.description: End page of this page range. Page numbers are indexed from 1 to N.

PageManipulationPageRanges.title: pageRanges
PageManipulationPageRanges.description: Page ranges of a PDF file. Pages in a document can be can be referred in any order, either from the start or end. For e.g.: For a file containing 10 pages, page number 1 can be referred using 1 or -10, page number 10 can be referred using 10 or -1. For performing an operation on the last page, we can provide a range as -1:-1. A page range provided is relative to the input document.

visible.description: Specified whether the seal field is visible or not.

location.description: Specifies the coordinates of the signature appearance's bounding box in default PDF user space units. The location is only required for visible signatures if the signature field does not already exist in the PDF document.If location is provided along with the existing signature field then it is ignored.

top.description: Specifies the top-most y-coordinate of the seal appearance's bounding box in default PDF user space units.

left.description: Specifies the left-most x-coordinate of the seal appearance's bounding box in default PDF user space units.

right.description: Specifies the right-most x-coordinate of the seal appearance's bounding box in default PDF user space units.

bottom.description: Specifies the bottom-most y-coordinate of the seal appearance's bounding box in default PDF user space units.

fieldName.description: The signature field's name. This must be a non-empty string. If signature field with this field name already exist, that field will be used. If it does not exist, a signature field with this field name will be created.

pageNumber.description: Specifies the page number to which the signature field should be attached. Page numbers are 1-based. The page number is only required for visible signatures if the signature field does not already exist in the pdf document. If page number is provided along with the existing signature field then the page number should be same on which signature field is present in the document, else an error is thrown.

metadata.description: Json containing metadata information about pdf document such as the title, the fonts used, and security settings.

document.description: Details like page count, pdf version, number of times PDF is edited, if it is a XFA, has form fields etc.

is_XFA.description: Document is based on the XFA (Extensible Forms Architecture) format or not

has_acroform.description: If the file contains any form fields.

has_embedded_files.description: Document contains embedded files or not.

incremental_save_count.description: Number of times the file is edited and saved.

is_certified.description: Document has been digitally signed with a certifying signature or not.

is_signed.description: If the PDF file is digitally signed.

is_linearized.description: If it is a linearized PDF file that makes viewing faster over the Internet.

is_portfolio.description: If it is a portfolio PDF - multiple documents are packaged together into one PDF File.

is_tagged.description: If it is a tagged PDF.

is_FTPDF.description: If it is a Fully Tagged PDF file.

pdfa_compliance_level.description: Returns the pdfa compliance level for the input file

pdfe_compliance_level.description: Returns the pdfe compliance level for the input file

pdfua_compliance_level.description: Returns the pdfua compliance level for the input file

pdfvt_compliance_level.description: Returns the pdfvt compliance level for the input file

pdfx_compliance_level.description: Returns the pdfx compliance level for the input file

fonts.description: Tag describing list of fonts in input pdf

font_type.description: Font technology (type) - eg. Type 1, TrueType, OpenType

family_name.description: Font's family name. Example - For font "Times Bold Italic", family name is "Times"

name.description: The PostScript name of the font

Creator.description: The one by which the PDF is created. Eg. Adobe Acrobat 21.5.

ModDate.description: Date when the file is last modified.

Producer.description: By which we get PDF for example Adobe Acrobat 21.5 Image Conversion Plug-in.

Author.description: The one who created the PDF.

security_info.description: Details related to encryption if it is an encrypted PDF like encrypted for metadata, file attachments, permissions for copying, editing, printing etc.

bit_length.description: The number of bits in a key used by a cryptographic algorithm.

encrypt_attachments_only.description: If the PDF is encrypted only for file attachments.

encrypt_metadata.description: If the PDF is encrypted for metadata.

has_owner_password.description: If the file has a password for any permissions ( like to edit, copy etc)

has_user_password.description: If the file has a password to open it.

permissions.description: Permission settings include restricting printing, content copying, editing, page extracting, commenting, etc in the PDF

assistive_technology.description: Whether or not the file will be exposed to a screen reader.

form_filling.description: Permission for filling in form fields.

copying.description: Permission for copying the content of file.

document_assembly.description: Permission for adding or inserting pages.

commenting.description: Permission to add comments to file.

editing.description: Permission for editing the content in file.

pages.description: Json array consisting page level properties

is_scanned.description: If the page is scanned or not.

is_empty.description: If it is an empty/blank page.

has_images.description: If the page has any images.

number_of_images.description: Number of images in that page.

only_images.description: If the page consists only images.

has_text.description: If the pages has any text.
